tags.name: Discover
tags.description: Discover popular, latest and most downloaded subtitles

tags.name: Subtitles
tags.description: Subtitles search for a specific release

post.description:
Create a token to authenticate a user. If response code is ```401 Unathorized``` stop sending further requests with same credentials.

Request limit is set 1 request per 1 second.

delete.description: Destroy a user token to end a session. Bearer token is required for this endpoint.

get.description: List subtitle formats recognized by the API

200.description: Get the languages table containing the codes and names used through the API

get.description: Gather informations about the user authenticated by a bearer token. User information are already sent when user is authenticated, and the remaining downloads is returned with each download, but you can also get these information here.
Discover popular features on opensubtitles.com, according to last 30 days downloads.
Discover popular subtitles, according to last 30 days downloads on opensubtitles.com. This list can be filtered by language code or feature type (movie, episode)

With the "query" parameter, search for a Feature from a simple text input. Typically used for a text search or autocomplete.

With an ID, get basic information and subtitles count for a specific title.

<!-- theme: warning -->

> ### Watch Out!
>
> If you create an autocomplete, don't set a too small refresh limit, remember you must not go over 40 requests per 10 seconds!

parameters.name: query
parameters.description: query to search, release/file name accepted

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: empty to list all or **movie**, **tvshow** or **episode**.

parameters.name: tmdb_id
parameters.description: TheMovieDB ID - combine with type to avoid errors

parameters.name: year
parameters.description: Filter by year. Can only be used in combination with a query

get.description:
Find subtitle for a video file. All parameters can be combined following various logics: searching by a specific external id (imdb, tmdb), a file moviehash, or a simple text query.

<!-- theme: warning -->
> Something wrong? Read about [common mistakes and best practices](docs/2-Best-Practices.md)

Implement the logic that best fit your needs, remembering that:
- if you can get moviehash from file - send it
- if you know the ID, IMDB or TMDB, send this rather than a query, an ID will always be more precise
- if you search for TV show episodes, sending the parent ID, episode and season number will give best results
- send the filename as query parameter together with the moviehash for better results. If your filenames are generally irrelevant, for example a dynamically generated filename from a streaming service, no need to send it.
- you can combine all together (send everything what you have and we will take of rest)


> Avoid http redirection by sending request parameters sorted and without default values, and send all queries in lowercase. Remove leading zeroes in IMDB ID

### Moviehash 
If a moviehash is sent with a request, a "moviehash_match" boolean field will be added to the response.

The matching subtitles will always come first in the response.


### Ordering
You can order the results using the *order_by* parameter. Ordering is possible on the following fields:
_ language, download_count, new_download_count, hearing_impaired, hd, format, fps, votes, points, ratings, from_trusted, foreign_parts_only, ai_translated, machine_translated, upload_date, release, comments _

Change the order direction with *order_direction* (asc/desc)

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of the movie or episode

parameters.name: imdb_id
parameters.description: IMDB ID of the movie or episode

parameters.name: tmdb_id
parameters.description: TMDB ID of the movie or episode

parameters.name: user_id
parameters.description: To be used alone - for user uploads listing

parameters.name: order_by
parameters.description: Order of the returned results, accept any of above fields

parameters.name: order_direction
parameters.description: Order direction of the returned results (asc,desc)

200.description: Find subtitles for a video file

post.description:
Request a download url for a subtitle. 


> The download count is calculated on this action, not the file download itself

> IN and OUT FPS must be indicated for subtitle conversions, we want to make sure you know what you are doing, and therefore collected the current FPS from the subtitle search result, or calculated it somehow.

<!-- theme: warning -->

> The download URL is temporary, and cannot be used more than 3 hours, so do not cache it, but you can download the file more than once if needed.

in_fps.description: used for conversions, in_fps and out_fps must then be indicated

out_fps.description: used for conversions, in_fps and out_fps must then be indicated

200.description: Request a download url for a subtitle.

get.description:
Extracts as much information as possible from a video filename.

It has a very powerful matcher that allows to guess properties from a video using its filename only. This matcher works with both movies and tv shows episodes.

This is a simple implementation of the python guessit library.
https://doc.guessit.io

Find examples of the returned data.
https://doc.guessit.io/properties/

Api-Key.description: Application API key obtained in the user profile of app developer on opensubtitles.com to authorise the **application**
Api-Key.name: Api-Key

Bearer.description: User token created in the login endpoint to authorise opensubtitles.com **user**
